In his broadcast, Bannon sharply criticized the current GOP leadership for their handling of fiscal issues and election integrity, urging a radical shift in strategy and attitude. And he also reminded his audience about the importance of their vigilance in voting.

Turning to election strategy, Bannon stressed the importance of robust grassroots activism to support Trump’s campaign. He pointed out the GOP’s recent failures, including the loss of the White House in 2020 and the narrow Republican majority in the House, noting that “Trump will deliver the votes” and calling for a concerted effort to prevent any election manipulation. He emphasized that the focus should be on ensuring that votes are counted accurately, not just through elaborate theories but through practical measures: “We need to make sure that they’re not stolen.”

As Bannon transitioned from his regular national commentator to a top podcaster and a more hands-on leader within GOP grassroots efforts in his force multiplier academy, he reminded us of the critical need for organized local action to complement Trump’s efforts.

He pointed to the importance of uniting under the local party structures and emphasized that addressing local issues is vital for broader electoral success. “The grassroots want to make a difference,” Bannon concluded, urging supporters to engage actively in local politics to drive national change.

During the segment, Bannon condemned the idea of a clean Continuing Resolution (CR) in Congress, labeling it an unacceptable compromise. He argued that “a clean CR is impossible” and warned against the disastrous effects of maintaining a two-trillion-dollar deficit, asserting, “You have two trillion dollars last Thursday was a debacle.” He criticized the lack of meaningful fiscal cuts and expressed skepticism about optimistic financial projections, saying, “I did an investment banking long enough to know when it is BS.”

Bannon also urged Republicans to break free from fear and media influence. “Stop being petrified by the unit party,” he said, encouraging GOP members to engage boldly in their duties and make their voices heard. He criticized some members’ “petrified” nature and called for a more assertive, more decisive approach.

BANNON WAS RIGHT

Highlighting the broader implications of current policies, Bannon warned of a looming economic and geopolitical crisis, comparing the situation to a biblical apocalypse: “You gotta start at the beginning, go to the end, go. The last part, is that where we are expanding third world war.”

Bannon’s remarks paint a picture of urgency and strategic recalibration as Republicans prepare for the 2024 elections, with a clear focus on reclaiming lost ground and ensuring the integrity of the voting process.

Here is a flashback from Bannon, now a political prisoner, who 8 months ago was telling the WarRoom to get ready to go and vote:

Bannon: “Trump will deliver the votes, we need to make sure they’re not stolen”

title: Charlie Kirk Slams Bidenomics and Amplifies JD Vance’s Hopeful Message About Youth’s Economic Struggle
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Monday morning, in a WarRoom discussion, Charlie Kirk strongly critiqued the current economic situation under the Biden administration while championing...
content:
Monday morning, in a WarRoom discussion, Charlie Kirk strongly critiqued the current economic situation under the Biden administration while championing the rising star of conservative politics, JD Vance. Kirk, known for his influential role as the host of “Turning Point” and his work in mobilizing young voters, offered a compelling analysis of both political and economic dynamics affecting America.

Kirk’s admiration for JD Vance was evident as he recounted a recent rally in Glendale, Arizona, where Vance’s appeal was on full display.

He noted, "I came to the rally about an hour before it started, and there were at least 2,000 people who couldn’t get in.”

Despite the sweltering 108-degree heat, the overwhelming turnout highlighted Vance’s strong grassroots support. Kirk praised Vance as a "rock star” and "one of the greatest political talents” in the conservative movement, reflecting his belief that Vance’s ability to connect with the American Heartland stems from his personal experience of overcoming adversity. "JD Vance is really hitting his stride,” Kirk said, emphasizing Vance’s effectiveness in reaching out to voters who feel neglected by the political establishment.

Kirk’s discussion also focused on the economic struggles facing young Americans under the Biden administration. He criticized the current state of the economy, describing it as a severe challenge for young people trying to achieve traditional milestones such as homeownership. "If you thought it was hard to own a home before, just how about now?” Kirk questioned.

He pointed out that the annual income required to buy a single-family home has soared from $75,000 to $130,000, underscoring the significant financial pressure on younger generations. Kirk blamed the Biden administration’s economic policies, dubbing them as detrimental to the financial well-being of young people.

According to Kirk, the economic hardship faced by young voters is exacerbated by what he called "Kamala Harris’s” vision of a rental economy. "Kamala Harris wants to create a nation of renters,” Kirk argued, suggesting that the current administration’s policies are pushing people away from home ownership and toward a more transient lifestyle. He portrayed this as part of a broader pattern of economic mismanagement that has eroded the American Dream for many young people.

In contrast, Kirk lauded former President Donald Trump’s economic proposals as a beacon of hope. He asserted that Trump’s approach is designed to revitalize the American economy and restore opportunities for young people. "Donald Trump wants to revitalize the backbone of this Great Nation,” Kirk said, emphasizing Trump’s commitment to making homeownership and financial stability achievable again. Kirk called on younger voters to support Trump, arguing that he is the only candidate capable of reversing the current economic malaise. "If the younger generation wants to be rich like their parents, they have to vote Trump,” Kirk declared, reinforcing his belief that Trump’s policies offer a path to economic recovery.

Kirk’s remarks encapsulate a stark critique of Bidenomics and a passionate endorsement of JD Vance’s growing political influence.

Kirk Reveals The “Subterranean Cultural Indicator” That Americans Are Loving J.D. Vance’s Story

title: The National Association of Black Journalists Continue to Prove Their Irrelevance
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Every time I think the National Association of Black Journalists (NABJ) cannot become any more irrelevant, they prove me wrong....
content:
Every time I think the National Association of Black Journalists (NABJ) cannot become any more irrelevant, they prove me wrong.

I have been a member of the organization for decades, despite many temptations to cancel my membership because their leadership has made a conscious decision to become an "unofficial” part of the Democrat Party and no longer a "professional” organization.

If you need any evidence of my assertion, one need only look at the debacle that took place at their national conference in Chicago last week.

NABJ has a new president, Ken Lemon. I do not know him and since he is new to his position, I will reserve judgement of him at this time. But I will give him a great deal of credit for displaying wise leadership for inviting presidential candidate Donald Trump to address their convention, as he did Kamala Harris, the Democrat candidate. Trump accepted and Harris declined. So much for Democrats valuing radical liberal Black voters like members of NABJ.

The mere fact that inviting Trump caused so much controversy within the group shows their radical liberal bias! Despite the loud protest from its radical liberal Democrat members, Lemon stood his ground and the Trump invitation was not rescinded.

But where Lemon did show his radical liberal bias was how he structured the meeting with Trump. He was pressured into being soooooo politically correct that he chose three Black female reporters to do the interview: Rachel Scott from ABC News, Harris Faulker from FOX NEWS, and Kadia Goba from Semafor.

The continued marginalization of the Black male, by a group led by a Black male. Go figure! How do you justify not having any male reporters participating, but I digress? As of this writing, NABA has refused to confirm what the agreed upon terms of the panel discussion were.

Trump has said one thing and NABJ has said another. Neither side has shown anything that could be confirmed; thus, the event continues to be a royal mess.

For those who have yet to see the event, you can watch on C-SPAN. Do not use any other source as it will most likely be edited to reflect certain political bias. Rachel Scott, from ABC News, thoroughly embarrassed herself and the profession of journalism with her "sista” girl tactics.

She was totally rude and disrespectful to Trump right out the gate. You do not have to like Trump, but he is still a former president. She was attempting to make her bones off Trump and he totally destroyed her like he did Kaitlan Collins from CNN a couple of months earlier!

One of the oldest unwritten rules of journalism is that the reporter should never become part of the story. Unfortunately, in today’s world, journalists seek to be not just a part of the story; they now want to be the story. This is why most Americans do not trust or respect the media.

This was Trump’s "Sister Souljah” moment on steroids!!! A Sister Souljah moment is simply when you go to a group’s convention and denounce a prominent member of their organization to curry favor with another demographic group that has no affiliation with the group you are speaking to.

So, in 1992 presidential candidate, Bill Clinton, attended Jesse Jackson’s Rainbow Push’s annual conference and denounced rapper Sister Souljah to curry favor with white moderate Democrats; and it got him elected president in 1992!

In this instance, Rachel Scott was Sister Souljah and got her butt wiped across the floor by Donald Trump. Unfortunately, most Black professional groups have all decided to be a part of the Democrat Party versus a professional group.

This explains why they are all hurting for money and have little to no influence within the industries they are supposed to be a part of. NABJ absolutely does not represent the rank and file in the Black community and are in constant violation of the Society of Professional Journalist’s code of ethics (SPJ).

SPJ is the governing body for all things journalism. Their code of ethics has been considered the Bible of journalism for decades.

If NABJ were lawyers or certified public accountants (CPAs), they would lose their license because they are in constant violations of their own code of ethics. Many NABJ members call me when they cannot get Republicans to return their calls when they are working on stories.

When Republicans get calls from Black reporters, whether they work for Black or mainstream media, their default position is that it is going to be a hit piece; therefore, they are reluctant to return the call. This view by Republicans is not without merit! I think NABJ and many Black reporters have definitely earned this reputation.’

As I am wont to say, radical liberal groups like NABJ and radical liberal Democrat operatives like Roland Martin, Joy Reid, April Ryan, Laura Coats, and Abby Phillip, etc., do more harm to the Black community than anybody with a white hood over their face.

NABJ constantly plays the race card and constantly complains about the lack of "diversity” within mainstream media and their executive suites; yet they are guilty of doing the same thing they accuse the big boys of doing.

Where is the "ideological” diversity within NABJ?

Why are all their national, regional, and local conferences all stacked with 99% radical liberal Democrat speakers and panelists? A couple of years ago, they allowed Planned Parenthood to sponsor a panel at their national convention in support of abortion. Yes, you heard me right!

NABJ pushes a radical liberal agenda and I have talked with their leadership incessantly, to no avail. Their leadership is very well aware of my connections at the highest levels of the Republican Party, but leadership never comes to me for input as they are planning their conferences. But they demand from white folks what they are not willing to give to Black folks.

This is why industry executives do not take them seriously as an organization and why they are totally irrelevant to the Black community.

These radical liberal Democrat groups like the Black Journalists, the Black Accountants, the Black MBAs, the NAACP, the National Urban League, the Black Economic Alliance (BEA) etc. cannot be reformed or refined, but rather they must be rebuilt from the ground up.

Radical liberal Democrat members of these groups must be rooted out and replaced by people who are capable and willing to put their personal politics to the side in order to promote the mission of said group.

I am speaking about radical liberal Democrat operatives like Roland Martin, Joy Reid, April Ryan, Don Lemon, Marc Morial, Al Sharpton, Derrick Johnson, Samantha Tweedy, and Angela Rye. You know, the usual cast of characters.

Even though the focus of this column is the NABJ, you can replace their name with any number of other so-called Black professional organizations whose leadership has turned many of these organizations into sycophantic bases of support for the Democrat radical leftist agenda.

I would welcome the opportunity to host a series of town hall meetings across the country so we can discuss these issues in a public setting.

I can most assuredly say in advance that I do not believe I will have any takers because radical liberal Democrats and their organizations are afraid of being publicly challenged and rarely, if ever, want to debate their position in the marketplace of ideas.

This is why the NABJ and other Black organizations have proven to be irrelevant to both the Black and white communities simultaneously!

Raynard Jackson is a Pulitzer Award nominated columnist and founder and chairman of Black Americans for a Better Future (BAFBF), a federally registered 527 Super PAC established to get more Blacks involved in the Republican Party. BAFBF focuses on the Black entrepreneur. For more information about BAFBF, visit www.bafbf.org.

You can follow Raynard on Twitter @RealRaynardJ or Gettr @RaynardJackson

title: The Biden-Harris Destruction of Blue Collar America
author: EDITOR3
excerpt: Arizona • In March 2023, Westfall Technik, a global plastics manufacturing company, announced it would close two of its plants...
content:
Arizona

• In March 2023, Westfall Technik, a global plastics manufacturing company, announced it would close two of its plants in Tempe.
o The plant closures resulted in 114 workers being laid off.
• In 2023, several of Arizona’s coal-fired power plants owned by Tri-State Generation and Transmission and Tucson Electric Power announced they were shutting down due to the Biden Administration’s anti-worker EPA rules which were introduced in May 2023 and finalized in April 2024.
o The rules resulted in the shutdown of many coal-firedpower plants across the nation, which power approximately 20% of America’s electricity.
o The plant shutdowns cost hundreds of American jobs and millions of taxpayer dollars.
o Larry Behrens, Power the Future: "Climate elitists are never more happy than when they’re destroying energy jobs and making it impossible for working families to get by, so it’s no surprise they’re celebrating,” he told The Center Square. “What advocates laughably call ‘clean energy’ is failing on a massive scale and often leaving taxpayers and ratepayers to holding the bag. Shutting down reliable power that has worked for decades to replace it with inferior Chinese-made energy products is a tragedy, not cause for celebration.””
• On top of this, the Arizona Corporation Commission—a state-government run organization which ensures that residents have access to reliable and safe utility services—has slashed financial assistance for the Navajo Nation and many other indigenous tribes who suffered job loss as a result of coal plant shutdowns.

Georgia

• In February 2024, Flexsteel, a furniture manufacturing company located in Dublin, announced it would shut down.
o As a result, over 150 employees were laid off.
• In March 2024, Jindall Films Americas, a manufacturer offilms for flexible packaging and labeling such as recyclable biaxially oriented polyethylene films announced it would close its LaGrange plant.
o 100 workers were laid off.
• In April 2024, 1888 Mills, one of the top home supply manufacturers in the U.S. specializing in manufacturing linen towels, announced it would no longer be producing towels domestically, and shut down.
o It was one of the few remaining linen towel manufacturers in the U.S., and employed 340 workers on the outskirts of Atlanta.
• In 2024, Caesarstone Technologies, Inc., a countertops manufacturer, plans to shut down its Richmond Hill plant.
o The move will impact 100 workers.

Indiana

• In March 2024, Tyson Foods, one of America’s and the world’s largest food manufacturing companies and second largest animal protein producer in the world, shuttered its chicken manufacturing plant located in Corydon.
o Tyson had a $64 million economic impact on Harrison County, and the plant shutting down impacts nearly 400 workers—although only nearly 200 remain.
o This plant was one of six Tyson plants that shut down in 2024 due to Bidenflation.

Michigan

• In May 2024, leading coregulated box manufacturer, Georgia-Pacific, announced it would shut down its Milan plant and that all employees would be laid off by July 2024.
o Nearly 120 workers were laid off.
o The decision apparently came down to "economics” and the ability for the company to be competitive long term.
• In March 2024, National Standard, a leading wire manufacturer, shut down its plant in the Niles area.
o Over 80 employees were laid off as a result.
o Larry Trussell, Owner of Trussell Complete Auto Repair: "It’s pretty upsetting, and it’s going to affect a lot of people in town…It’s scary, and it’s happening so much of the time around the country. These businesses are folding up and downsizing.”
o Jeff Rea, President and CEO of the Greater Niles Chamber: "It’s been an important fixture in our community. They’ve called Niles home for over 100 years…It’s a really sad day in town when something like this happens. We are disappointed by the decision, and especially disappointed in the lack of communication.”
• In March 2023, Dawson Manufacturing Co., an auto parts manufacturer in Benton Harbor, announced it would shut down, and laid off 90 full time employees.
o Dawson was 55% minority owned and certified as a minority business enterprise (MBE).
o Dawson was 45% owned by TrelleborgVibracoustic, a German auto parts manufacturer, which has announced assembly and production expansions in Europe and Mexico.
o Dawson’s former customers included General Motors and Ford.
• In January 2024, Graphic Packaging International LLC, a manufacturer of fiber-based consumer packaging in the Grand Rapids area, shuttered its plant and laid off over 110 employees.
o In 2022, Graphic Packaging also shut down its Battle Creek manufacturing plant, laying off 200 workers, in addition to several other plants around the country.

Nevada

• In April 2024, Tesla announced it would lay off 700 workers in Sparks in an effort to cut costs amidst the Biden-Harris Green New Scam transition.
o Tesla had been suffering from decreased sales of their electric vehicles which led to decreased profits for the company.
o Tesla also had to decrease their prices of electric vehicles by $20,000 due to slowing demand.\
• In July 2023, NV Energy announced it would convert the final existing coal-fueled plant at the North Valmy Generating Station to all natural gas, in addition to standing up a brand new solar and battery storage project as part of the state’s Green New Deal efforts.
o The move is costing taxpayers$2 billion.
o NV Energy also requests additional billions in taxpayer funding to building additional solar fields, two natural gas turbines, and new transmission infrastructure projects.

North Carolina

• In July 2024, United Furniture Industries, Inc., a Mississippi-based furniture manufacturer, announced it would close two production plants in Winston-Salem and High Point, impacting nearly 300 workers.
o Another United Furniture Industries plant recently shuttered in Mississippi, impacting another 220 jobs.
• In April 2024, an electronics manufacturer, East West, announced it would idle two plants in Mooresville, laying off nearly 100 workers.
o The company has existed since the 1980s, and has expanded across the United States.
• In July 2023, Snyders-Lance, a subsidiary of Campbells Soup that manufactures pretzels, chips, and other salty snacks, announced that it would shut down a major building in its manufacturing plant in Charlotte.
o Nearly 130 workers were laid off.
• In August 2023, Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams, a furniture manufacturer, shut down its main plant in Taylorsville and laid off over 530 employees.
o Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams manufactured furniturein Taylorsville since the 1980s, and was considered one of the largest employers in the county.
o Becky Smith, an employee at Rogers Mills, a nearby animal feed store, on the shutdown: "We all have lived here. We all know people, and so it really shocked everybody…That is what we live off of here in this county — is furniture.”
o Mitchell Gold shut down several other plants across the state including in Hiddenite and Statesville.
• In August 2023, Smithfield Foods, a meat manufacturer headquartered in Virginia, announced it would shut down its pork processing plant in Charlotte.
o Smithfield Foods is owned by Chinese-owned conglomerate WH Group.
o Livestock economist, Lee Schulz, discussed how consumers have purchased less pork due to skyrocketing inflation, while the price of feed for livestock remains high.
o This has led to the largest negative profits for U.S. pork producers since 1998.
• In January 2022, DENSO Manufacturing, an auto parts manufacturer located in Grreeneville, shut down its manufacturing plant.
o 500 workers were laid off.
• In March 2021, Krispy Kreme, popular doughnut maker, shuttered its North Carolina facility in Concord.
o As a result, 102 employees were laid off.

Minnesota

• In July 2024, Smith Foundry, a prominent iron manufacturer in Minneapolis, announced it would shut down its casting and furnace operations in August due to Biden’s oppressive air pollution rules.

o The foundry is now forced to convert only to a metal finishing facility, meaning that it will likely have to import iron from overseas, and will pay an $80,000 fine to the federal government for violating the Clean Air Act.

o 50 workers will be laid off.
• In April 2023, H.B. Fuller, an adhesive manufacturer for both the construction and healthcare industries, shut downtwo manufacturing plants in Minneapolis.
o 300 workers were laid off.
o The company highlighted the lack of demand from industry and high input costs as a reason for the shutdowns.
• In May 2024, Nortech Systemsm a prominent Minnesota electronics manufacturer, announced it would shut down its manufacturing facility in Blue Earth by the end of the year.
o Over 70 workers will be laid off.
• In July 2024, Rich Products Corporation, a global food manufacturer of bakery, meat, and seafood, announced it would shutter its plant by the end of the year.
o Rich Products supplies major food companies such as Carvel, F’Real, and Byron’s Smokehouse.
o 170 workers will be laid off.

Ohio

• In May 2024, ZF Active Safety US, an electronics manufacturer located in Findlay,  announced it would close its plant.
o Over 230 workers jobs will be laid off.
• In December 2023, Post Holdings, a large cereal manufacturer, will close its manufacturing facility in Lancaster by September 2024.
o 200 workers will be at risk of losing their jobs.

Pennsylvania

• In January 2024, Newbold Services LLC, a South Carolina-based company that provides janitorial, staffing, security, and other services, announced it would be closing eight different facilities in Pennsylvania.
o Nearly 300 workers will be laid off.
• In July 2023, Homer City Generating Station, Pennsylvania’s largest coal-fired power plant located an hour outside of Pittsburgh, shut down after being operational for over fifty years due to Biden’s harsh new environmental rules on nitrogen oxides.
o Over 130 workers were laid off.
o Biden’s rules made production too expensive for the plant to remain operational.
o Homer City expressed concern over Pennsylvania joining the Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative (RGGI), which is a twelve-state compact to set caps on greenhouse gas emissions.
o Homer City Statement: "RGGI will severely limit Homer City’s ability to plan long term and it will handcuff the business in making further investments with an uncertain regulatory future,” the statement said.
o Allegheny-Fayette County Labor Council: "It is not a victory when hundreds of in-house workers and thousands of subcontractors — a majority of whom are members of our labor council — will lose good union jobs…We recognize the need to transition to cleaner energy, but we operate in reality. The reality is that far too many working people are being left behind in that transition.”
• In April 2024, Paris Uniform Services, a supplier of uniforms, work apparel, facility services, and cleaning products, will close four locations across Pennsylvania.
o The plants that will be closing are located inHarrisburg, Bradford, Williamsport, and Dubois.
o 138 workers will be laid off.
• In September 2023, Kennametal, a machinery and materials manufacturer based in Pittsburgh, announced it would be closing three to five of its manufacturing plants in Pennsylvania over the next four years.
o The company has already closed six manufacturing plants over the past several years, including in Irwin.
• In September 2023, The Ames Corporation, a manufacturer of long-handed tools, lawn and garden products, and wheelbarrows, announced it was shuttering its plants near Camp Hill and in Harrisburg by October 2023.
o Over 180 workers were laid off.

South Carolina

• In June 2024, Tupperware announced it would shut down its last remaining manufacturing plant in the United States located in Hemingway.
o Tupperware is moving all of its production to Mexico.
o 150 workers will be laid off.
• In March 2023, Stanley Black & Decker announced it would shut down its Cheraw plant.
o Nearly 200 workers were laid off.
o Under stable economic conditions in May 2019 with President Trump in office,  Stanley Black & Decker built a brand new 420,000 square foot manufacturing facility in Forth Worth, Texas, in an effort to bring manufacturing back to the United States.

Wisconsin

• In March 2024, Master Lock, a manufacturer of padlocks, safes, combination locks and other security products that is headquartered in Wisconsin, announced it would begin the process of closing its plant in Milwaukee starting in October.
o Nearly 400 employees will be laid off.
o United Autoworkers Region 4 Director, Brandon Campbell: "I want to be clear – UAW workers at Local 469 have done their part – they have got no more to give…"They need to concede NOTHING to this company to convince them to keep work in the USA – the company should keep work here because THIS is where their profits come from.”
• In April 2024, Jeld-Wen, a global designer, manufacturer and distributor of high-performance interior and exterior doors, windows, and related building products, announced it would close its plant in Hawkins.
o Over 330 workers will be laid off.
• In October 2023 and January 2024, Energizer Holdings, a battery manufacturer, announced it would close both its Fennimore manufacturing facility by September 2024, and its Portage manufacturing facility in March 2024.
o Energizer plans to offshore jobs to Singapore and a non-union plant in North Carolina.
o Over 170 workers will be laid off at the Fennimore facility, and 135 workers will be laid off at the Portage facility.

Virginia

• In July 2024, Keurig Dr. Pepper, which manufactures K-Cup pods for coffee machines, announced it would shutter its Windsor facility by end of 2024.
o Nearly 400 workers will be laid off.
• In March 2023, Tyson Foods announced it would be closing its Glen Allen production facility.
o The closure was so detrimental to the local economy and workers down the supply chain, for example, chicken farmers, that the Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (VDACS) announced the Central Virginia Poultry Cooperative (CVPC) to attract new business to the area and financially assist farmers impacted by the closure.
o 700 workers were laid off.
Joanna Miller is a Former White House Senior Policy Analyst and currently serves on President Trump’s 2024 Presidential Campaign

title: Vintage Bannon ‘Shackled by Debt’: Fiery Indictment of Democrats and Their Globalist Overlords
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: Before Steve Bannon was forced to surrender as a political prisoner, he delivered remarks to the WarRoom audience that exposed...
content:
Before Steve Bannon was forced to surrender as a political prisoner, he delivered remarks to the WarRoom audience that exposed precisely why the Democrats wanted to see him censored and shackled in a Federal correctional facility for the last four months leading up to the historic 2024 election.

Using his expertise as a financial expert, Bannon has deconstructed the corporate media’s messaging on government spending so that every layperson can understand and vote accordingly.

Bannon has frequently stated, "The citizens of the United States should not be in bondage to anything. Any institution. Any instrument like money. Nothing.”

The following is a flashback, some vintage Bannon, from late June 2024, where Bannon ripped apart the corporate media’s messaging and trashed an Axios article meant to gaslight voters:

Bannon’s comments on the Democrats’ foreign funding and what he describes as “bondage for the American people” are a powerful critique of the current political landscape. Bannon, known for his fiery rhetoric and unapologetic defense of populism, has consistently voiced concerns about the influence of globalists and foreign interests in American politics. He argues that this influence is detrimental to the sovereignty and well-being of the United States and its citizens.

During the June broadcast of the WarRoom, Bannon argued that the Democratic Party has become a tool for globalist interests, funded by foreign billionaires who seek to undermine the American way of life. In his view, this foreign funding creates a situation where the American people are placed in “bondage” to global financial systems and markets.

Bannon believes that this financial bondage is a new form of slavery, where Americans are shackled by debt and fiscal irresponsibility orchestrated by political elites in cahoots with globalists. He passionately claims, “These Federal spending [programs] are bondage. It’s the new slavery. It’s bondage to world debt markets and world capital markets.”

Bannon has been a vocal critic of President Joe Biden’s economic policies, accusing him of leading the country into massive debt. According to Bannon, the Biden administration’s approach to fiscal policy is reckless, causing inflation and hardship for ordinary Americans. He contrasts this with what he sees as the “golden age” of the Trump administration, citing low inflation and interest rates as indicators of economic prosperity.

In a pointed critique on that program, Bannon emphasized, “They are telling bald-face lies about how much debt Joe Biden’s front versus Donald Trump, and we’re getting experts to break that down.” He specifically calls out Axios, a media outlet, for perpetuating what he sees as misinformation about the national debt under Biden.

Bannon is not just a critic but a strategist who calls for decisive actions. He advocates for a government shutdown to force a national conversation about fiscal responsibility. He argues that the American people need to wake up to the reality that they are being manipulated and financially enslaved by policies that benefit only the wealthy elite.

Bannon’s call to action is clear: “Shut the freaking government down and force a national conversation because I guarantee you when we show the American people that they’re held in bondage by this irresponsible fiscal madness that only enriches the wealthy, they’ll demand change.”

Bannon blamed globalists for gutting the American middle class and creating an economy that favors the Fortune 100 CEOs at the expense of ordinary citizens. He accuses these global elites of caring more about profits and control than about the well-being of American workers. “Globals, bring jobs back to America. You suck. The money comes. You send it back. Return to sender. We don’t want your greasy stolen money,” Bannon passionately states.

Bannon is also highly critical of Modern Monetary Theory (MMT), which he claims has been embraced by Democrats to justify endless spending without concern for deficits. He believes that MMT is a dangerous ideology that ignores the real-world consequences of unchecked government spending. “They embrace modern monetary theory. That deficits don’t matter. It don’t matter, and now they’re scared,” Bannon argues, emphasizing that the American public is beginning to see through these economic illusions.

To bolster his arguments, Bannon cites economists and frequent WarRoom guests like Steve Moore, E.J. Antoni, Scott Bessent, and Dave Brat. He believes these experts provide a clearer picture of the country’s economic challenges and the dangers of the current fiscal policies. “I’m gonna get Steve Moore, Scott Bessent, E.J. Antoni, and Dave Brat, because here’s what’s happened in the last 24-40 hours,” Bannon states, indicating his reliance on these voices to dismantle the narratives he sees as misleading.

Bannon’s fiery defense of the American people appears rooted in his belief that foreign interests and globalist agendas are compromising the nation’s sovereignty and economic future.

He sees this as a betrayal of the United States’ foundational values and calls for a radical reevaluation of its fiscal policies. His comments serve as a rallying cry for those who feel disenfranchised by the current political and economic systems, urging them to demand accountability and change.

For more context, watch the full segment with corporate media cold opens and Bannon’s remarks:

Bannon Calls Out The Globalists’ Crimes Against The American People

title: Understanding The Threat of China’s Global Ambitions with Gordan Chang
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: In a recent discussion on The War Room, Dave Brat hosted China expert Gordon Chang to explore the complex and...
content:
In a recent discussion on The War Room, Dave Brat hosted China expert Gordon Chang to explore the complex and often dangerous geopolitical dynamics involving China, the United States, and other global actors. The conversation centered around China’s strategic ambitions and current geopolitical maneuvers, painting a picture of a nation with grand territorial aspirations and a precarious economic backdrop that fuels its aggressive posture.

Chang argued that the world is facing its most dangerous time in history, even more so than the Cuban Missile Crisis.

“We knew then that Khrushchev and Kennedy were unwilling to use their nukes; we don’t know that about Xi Jinping, Kim Jong-un, and Vladimir Putin,” Chang warned. He criticized the current U.S. administration, stating, “We have a president who has checked out and is not defending our country.”

Chang opened the conversation by addressing a debate regarding China’s desire for war. Colonel Derrick Harvey had previously argued in the show that China does not want a war, particularly a kinetic one, because it would threaten its own existence.

However, Chang emphasized that while China may not seek direct military conflict, its actions signal a broader ambition for global dominance.

“China doesn’t want a kinetic war. What it wants is to annex territories of other nations,” Chang asserted. He further elaborated that China’s ultimate goal is to “destroy the United States” and “rule the moon and Mars as sovereign Chinese territory” without resorting to war.

Chang explained that China is actively engaging in activities akin to warfare through proxy conflicts and territorial intimidation. “China is fueling Russia’s war in Ukraine, fueling Iran’s attacks on Israel, and along with Russia, it’s fueling insurgencies in North Africa,” Chang noted. He highlighted China’s belligerent activities toward the Philippines, Taiwan, Japan, and India as potential preludes to direct conflict.

According to Chang, the political system in China has inherent incentives to pursue aggressive expansion, either through intimidation or territorial annexation.

Dave Brat pointed out that China’s extensive geopolitical ventures rely heavily on a robust economy, which appears to be weakening. “The Chinese economy is not growing at the 4.7% pace they claim for the second quarter of this year; it’s barely above zero, if that,” Brat observed.

Chang agreed, adding that the economic downturn inhibits China’s ability to finance its military and international projects like the Belt and Road Initiative. This economic strain makes China even more dangerous, as President Xi Jinping faces mounting pressure for a quick victory to consolidate his power.

Xi Jinping, Chang explained, is in a precarious position domestically. He has centralized power, making him accountable for the country’s economic woes. “Xi Jinping realizes that he’s being blamed for the economy, the demographic problems, and everything else,” Chang stated.

This personal accountability means Xi is at risk politically, driving him to seek quick victories to silence dissent within the Communist Party. Chang warned that Xi’s domestic incentives are “to be belligerent and provocative, which means he can take us by surprise.”

When asked about where Xi might seek a quick victory, Chang identified the Philippines as a likely target due to its perceived vulnerability. “A war on Taiwan would be very difficult and unpopular with the Chinese people,” Chang explained. “But with the Philippines, he thinks they’re an easy target.” He noted recent acts of aggression, including the seizure of Philippine vessels and the injuring of Filipino sailors, as potential precursors to more significant conflict.

Chang’s insights expose a world where China’s economic struggles and internal political pressures could lead to unexpected and potentially catastrophic global conflicts. As Chang’s analysis reveals, understanding China’s motivations and potential actions is crucial for navigating the current geopolitical landscape.

Chang’s new book, Plan Red: China’s Project to Destroy America, will be published by Newsmax on October 1st. It promises to explore these themes further, offering readers a detailed examination of China’s strategies and their implications for global security.

title: Trump: Raffensperger, Kemp Want 2024 to Be Stolen, Again
author: LIZ HARRINGTON
excerpt: President Trump honored members of the Georgia State Election Board fighting for transparency in elections, while simultaneously warning that Brad...
content:
President Trump honored members of the Georgia State Election Board fighting for transparency in elections, while simultaneously warning that Brad Raffensperger and Brian Kemp want a repeat of 2020’s failed and corrupt election in the Peach State this November.

President Trump acknowledged Dr. Janice Johnston, Rick Jeffares, and Janelle King who were in attendance at his Saturday rally at Georgia State University’s Convocation Center.

Dr. Johnston, who has been at the forefront for holding state and Fulton County officials accountable for their misrepresentations about 2020, received a standing ovation. She told President Trump, in the wake of being shot in an assassination attempt, his courage is contagious.

"Your courage is contagious, too,” he said.

President Trump specifically praised the group for voting to approve a rule change that requires the votes to be hand counted by three poll officers at the precinct level every day of voting to ensure the numbers match with the machines.

"Who could be against that?” President Trump said.

Maybe the ones still covering up 2020. The three hand counts at the precinct level differed so significantly that President Trump’s Election Day totals were off by nearly 50 percent in some cases. The tabulation machines undercounted these votes both times. Phillip Stark, a renowned statistics professor at the University of California, Berkeley, who created the risk limiting audit, said the "large, unexplained differences among these results” left voters with no confidence their voters were "counted at all, much less counted as cast.”

The second machine count and the hand count audit were thousands of votes short when they tried to recreate their purported results in Fulton County. Two State Election Board cases, SEB2021-181 and SEB2023-025, have proven the hand count audit included over 4,081 false votes for Joe Biden, and that the second machine count included thousands of duplicate votes. However, the Secretary of State’s office has tried to sweep both cases under the rug. Though Kemp and his office are keenly aware of the details of the fraudulent hand count, since they are the ones who confirmed Joe Rossi’s findings and sent a letter to the State Election Board which prompted the opening of the SEB2021-181 case, little has been done to ensure it can’t happen again in 2024.

Raffensperger and his general counsel Charlene McGowan are still claiming all three counts matched. The final count includes only 506,948 votes, far less than the certified 527,925 that includes 17,852 missing ballot images from tabulators that do not exist, and the aforementioned duplicates. McGowan falsely claimed it was "inconclusive” whether or not the over 3,125 duplicates were counted, when in fact there is evidence that not only were they counted, but were intentionally and fraudulentlyinserted into the official results. Removing the false votes from both cases would be enough to alter the outcome of 2020, which was claimed to be decided by 11,779 votes.

The State Election Board has an opportunity to continue the investigation into SEB2023-025, which documented all of these major discrepancies and the fact that the results were sent to an outside "consultant” working for the Elections Group, a shadowy organization that "chose Fulton County” when they popped up in cities in the major Swing States during the pivotal 2020 Election. The matter will be brought up at the next Board meeting on Tuesday, Aug. 6.

President Trump called out Raffensperger and Kemp for wanting Georgia to be stolen again.

"Raffensperger ought to make sure that the vote is honest,” he said. "They don’t want the vote to be honest. In my opinion, they want us to lose. And we can’t let that happen.”

title: China’s Shadow War, Dr. Bradley Thayer Exposes CCP’s Global Schemes and U.S. Strategic Failures
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: On Saturday's WarRoom program, with host Dave Brat, Dr. Bradley Thayer addressed three key topics regarding China's influence and threat...
content:
On Saturday’s WarRoom program, with host Dave Brat, Dr. Bradley Thayer addressed three key topics regarding China’s influence and threat to global stability.

Thayer told Brat that he concurs with Colonel John Mills’s analysis that “China is behind” most global hotspots, emphasizing that the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is akin to Reagan’s view of the Soviet Union as “the center of evil in the modern world.” Thayer argues that China’s political and military strategies are designed to “undermine the United States and our interests,” highlighting their expansion into Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia as part of their broader plan to overthrow the U.S. and its allies.

The following is an expanded discussion on each of the three points addressed by Thayer in the conversation with Dave Brat that are most important to understand about confronting the Chinese Communist Party:

1. China’s Role in Global Hotspots Thayer argues that China is a major instigator of global instability, asserting that the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is actively “igniting and sustaining a lot of these conflicts.” He agrees with Colonel John Mills’s analysis, which identifies China as a key player behind geopolitical tensions worldwide, including those in regions like the Caribbean, South America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East. According to Thayer, China’s influence is a direct threat to U.S. interests and global stability. He likens China’s current role to the Soviet Union during the Cold War, referencing Reagan’s view that the Soviet Union was “the center of evil in the modern world.” Thayer warns that China’s support for regimes like Russia and Iran is part of a broader strategy to undermine Western power and influence.

He emphasizes the significance of China’s strategic alliances, highlighting its “political warfare strength” and “military capabilities” as instruments used to destabilize regions and challenge U.S. hegemony. Thayer argues that “the fundamental point is to overthrow the United States,” highlighting the CCP’s intent to displace the U.S. as a global leader. He stresses the need to recognize the CCP as the primary driver of these global conflicts, suggesting that the CCP’s actions are designed to create a world order that favors authoritarian regimes. This calls for a concerted effort to counter China’s influence by recognizing the CCP as an illegitimate government that seeks to expand its power through “tyrannical methods.” Thayer calls for a coalition of “people of goodwill around the world” to combat the CCP’s ambitions and protect democratic values globally.

2. China’s Economic and Military Strength Thayer discussed China’s economic and military capabilities, highlighting both its strengths and vulnerabilities. He notes the mixed reports about China’s economic health, acknowledging the presence of “negative news on the economy” while also recognizing China’s “intelligent long-range plans” like the Belt and Road Initiative. Thayer points out that China has rapidly grown its economy over the past decades, converting this economic power into significant military and diplomatic strength. He argues that this expansion has enabled China to exert influence across the globe, making it a formidable adversary to the United States and its allies.

Despite the reports of economic decline, Thayer cautions against underestimating China’s potential. He states that “their economy has stalled,” but emphasizes that the CCP has accumulated substantial resources and power, allowing them to “convert that wealth into military might, diplomatic power, and technology.” This growth has positioned China as a major global player, capable of challenging the U.S. in various domains. Thayer warns that under Xi Jinping’s leadership, China is particularly dangerous, describing Xi as a “hyper-aggressive leader” who is willing to take risks to advance China’s interests. He emphasizes the importance of recognizing this threat and calls for strategic actions to counter China’s influence.

Thayer urges the U.S. to “cut off any investment with China” and focus on bolstering its own economy. He highlights the danger posed by Xi’s aggressive policies, warning that the CCP is likely to become “very aggressive” against the U.S. and its allies. Thayer’s analysis underscores the need for vigilance and strategic planning in addressing the challenges posed by China’s economic and military ambitions.

3. The Nature of the CCP and the Threat to the U.S. Thayer highlighted the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) as an existential threat to the United States, arguing that China is “at war with us today” through political warfare. He parallels the Cold War dynamics with the Soviet Union, asserting that China is engaged in a strategic conflict with the U.S., albeit not through direct military confrontation. Thayer warns that China has declared a “people’s war” against the United States, signaling its intent to undermine American sovereignty and global influence.

Thayer criticizes the CCP as an “illegitimate government” that rules through oppressive means and does not represent the Chinese people’s will. He points to historical events like Mao Zedong’s intentional famine, which resulted in the death of millions, as evidence of the regime’s disregard for human life. Thayer emphasizes that the CCP’s aggressive policies are driven by an ideology that prioritizes party interests over the well-being of the Chinese populace. He argues that the CCP’s actions are aimed at destabilizing the U.S. and promoting an authoritarian world order.

To counter this threat, Thayer advocates for a robust response from the U.S. and its allies. He urges policymakers to “stop investments and trade with China,” focusing instead on strengthening domestic industries and building alliances with “people of goodwill” worldwide.

Thayer emphasizes the importance of recognizing the CCP as a dangerous adversary and taking decisive actions to neutralize its influence. He calls for a collective effort to oppose the CCP’s ambitions and safeguard democratic values, highlighting the need for a strategic approach to counter China’s global influence.

title: Civil Liberties Under Siege: The Administrative State’s Stranglehold on Independent Media
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: The erosion of civil liberties in the modern era is intricately linked to the rise of an expansive administrative state,...
content:
The erosion of civil liberties in the modern era is intricately linked to the rise of an expansive administrative state, which increasingly seeks to manipulate public discourse and media landscapes to align with its narratives.

On Saturday’s WarRoom, discussions between Mike Benz and Dave Brat highlighted a concerning trend: the systematic suppression of alternative news sources by leveraging governmental and corporate power to enforce compliance with a state-sanctioned narrative.

On the program, Benz shed light on the aggressive tactics government agencies and their allies used to undermine independent media. According to Benz, the post-2016 election landscape saw a concerted effort by entities such as the U.S. State Department and various NGOs to stifle alternative media.

“After the 2016 election, the Health Security State and the foreign policy establishment embarked on a quest to kill advertising revenue to alternative news sources,” Benz stated.

He explained that this strategy was aimed at diminishing the influence of independent outlets that had gained traction against traditional media giants.

Benz’s latest report exposes a troubling alliance between censorship mercenary firms and major advertising agencies. “Censorship mercenary firms like NewsGuard and Global Disinformation Index now rate news organizations in a manner similar to Moody’s rating bonds,” Benz noted.

These firms create blacklists of websites deemed to spread misinformation, effectively directing advertising dollars away from these sources. This tactic not only cripples independent journalism but also consolidates media power within a few government-approved channels.

Benz criticized the government’s role in funding media operations that align with its objectives while marginalizing dissenting voices. “The government should not be in the business of determining winners and losers in the media landscape,” Benz argued. He highlighted how taxpayer money is used to support media organizations that propagate the administration’s preferred narratives, thus skewing public perception and undermining democratic discourse.

Brat echoed these concerns, emphasizing the need for voters to be aware of these dynamics. “When you see the rise of these censorship practices and the manipulation of media funding, it’s a red flag for civil liberties,” Brat remarked.

He urged citizens to scrutinize how administrative state actions could impact their rights and the integrity of public debate.

As the 2024 elections approach, it is crucial for voters to consider the implications of an administrative state that seeks to control the flow of information and stifle dissenting voices. The tactics employed by government entities and their corporate allies reflect a broader agenda to enforce conformity and suppress alternative viewpoints, posing a significant threat to individual freedoms and the democratic process.

The discussion between Benz and Brat is a stark reminder of the challenges facing civil liberties in an age of heightened governmental control. As voters prepare for the upcoming elections, they should be mindful of the broader implications of these trends and advocate for a media landscape that supports diverse and independent voices. The health of democracy depends on it.

title: Essential Insights for Voters: Col. Derek Harvey’s Key Warnings on Iran, China, and U.S. Domestic Challenges
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: On Saturday's WarRoom  Ret. Col. Derek Harvey addressed a number of the critical issues Americans should be considering before the...
content:
On Saturday’s WarRoom  Ret. Col. Derek Harvey addressed a number of the critical issues Americans should be considering before the November election.

Here are some notes from Harvey’s appearance with host, Dave Brat and the topics they discussed:

1. Iran’s Threat to Israel and Regional Instability Harvey emphasized Iran’s orchestrated campaign against Israel, aiming to destabilize the region through proxy groups like Hezbollah and Hamas. According to Harvey, Iran is seeking revenge for past assassinations and is planning a “multi-front campaign” that could pose significant risks to Israeli security and regional stability.

“Iran is not acting alone,” Harvey stated. “They are using Hezbollah and Hamas as proxies to open up a multi-front campaign against Israel. Their objective is not just about retaliation; it’s about exerting influence and destabilizing the region to weaken American allies.” He elaborated on Iran’s strategic objectives, explaining how their actions are part of a broader effort to erode U.S. influence in the Middle East and undermine alliances such as the Abraham Accords.

He highlighted the potential for increased conflict, emphasizing the need for the U.S. and its allies to be vigilant. “Iran’s actions are calculated and deliberate,” he said, “and they have a long-term vision to drive wedges between the U.S. and its partners in the region.”

Harvey also warned of Iran’s ambitions to expand its influence beyond the Middle East. “Iran is looking to assert itself as a regional power with global reach,” he remarked. “Their ambitions are not limited to Israel; they are a threat to broader regional stability and, by extension, global peace.”

Harvey’s analysis of Iran’s threat shows the complexities of Middle Eastern geopolitics and the urgent need for strategic responses to counter Iran’s ambitions. The multi-front campaign against Israel serves as a reminder of Iran’s relentless pursuit of regional dominance and the broader implications for U.S. foreign policy.

2. The Role of China and Russia Harvey highlighted the significant roles China and Russia play in undermining U.S. influence in the Middle East. He explained that these powers are leveraging regional instability to expand their influence and challenge Western dominance. “China and Russia are not just passive observers in the Middle East,” Harvey asserted. “They are actively working to undermine U.S. influence and disrupt the existing power dynamics.”

He described how China, in particular, is making strategic moves to align itself with key players in the region, emphasizing its economic and military investments. “China is looking to build alliances through economic ties and military cooperation,” Harvey explained. “They are using initiatives like the Belt and Road to increase their footprint and challenge U.S. interests.”

Similarly, he noted Russia’s actions in the region, highlighting their support for regimes that oppose U.S. policies. “Russia is playing a dangerous game,” Harvey stated. “They are backing authoritarian regimes and using their influence to sow discord among U.S. allies.”

Harvey stressed that the actions of China and Russia are not isolated incidents but part of a broader strategy to diminish U.S. influence globally. “This is a coordinated effort,” he said. “China and Russia are working in tandem to reshape the global order in their favor.”

In his view, this geopolitical maneuvering poses significant challenges for the U.S. and its allies. “We must recognize that the battle for influence is not just about military might but also about economic and political power,” Harvey concluded. “The U.S. needs to be proactive in countering these threats and ensuring that its alliances remain strong and resilient.”

3. China’s Global Ambitions and Internal Challenges Harvey exposed China’s global ambitions, emphasizing its strategic efforts to expand its influence through initiatives like the Belt and Road. However, he also pointed out China’s internal weaknesses that could hinder its long-term goals. “China’s ambitions are clear,” Harvey stated. “They seek to expand their global reach, but they face significant internal challenges that cannot be ignored.”

He discussed China’s geopolitical strategies, highlighting its efforts to form alliances and project power on a global scale. “China is not just focusing on the military,” Harvey explained. “They are leveraging economic power and soft diplomacy to create a network of alliances that serve their interests.”

Despite these ambitions, Harvey noted several internal challenges China faces, including economic debt, demographic issues, and a lack of innovation. “China’s growth is not sustainable,” he argued. “Their economic model is burdened with debt, and their aging population poses a significant demographic challenge.”

Harvey also pointed out that China’s technological advancements often rely on copying rather than innovating. “China’s innovation is not as robust as it appears,” he said. “They are still heavily reliant on acquiring technology from other countries.”

In his analysis, these internal challenges could limit China’s ability to achieve its long-term objectives. “China’s path to global dominance is not assured,” Harvey concluded. “Their internal vulnerabilities are significant, and they will need to address these issues to sustain their ambitions.”

Overall, Harvey’s insights into China’s global ambitions and internal challenges highlight the complexities of modern geopolitics. While China’s strategies pose a challenge to U.S. interests, its internal weaknesses could offer opportunities for the U.S. to counterbalance China’s influence and maintain global stability.

4. U.S. Domestic Political Challenges He talked about significant domestic political challenges in the U.S., particularly the lack of strategic planning in the previous Trump administration and the necessity for loyal personnel. “The Trump administration had a bold agenda, but it often lacked the strategic planning necessary to implement it effectively,” Harvey said. He pointed to the failure to deliver on key promises, such as repealing Obamacare, as examples of these challenges.

He emphasized the importance of having a cohesive administration aligned with the president’s goals, criticizing the appointment of officials who may not fully support the administration’s agenda. “Personnel is policy,” Harvey stated. “Without the right people in place, even the best plans can falter.”

Harvey also discussed the role of the  Administrative State and bureaucratic resistance to change. “The administrative state is a formidable force,” he explained. “It’s essential to have loyal personnel who understand the president’s vision and are committed to executing it.”

He argued that the lack of strategic foresight and unity in the administration often led to missed opportunities and political setbacks. “There was a disconnect between the president’s ambitions and the execution on the ground,” Harvey remarked.

In his view, future administrations must learn from these challenges and prioritize strategic planning and personnel loyalty. “The lessons of the past should guide future leaders,” Harvey concluded. “To succeed, we need an administration that is not only united in purpose but also adept at navigating the complexities of governance.”

Harvey’s analysis of U.S. domestic political challenges underscores the importance of strategic foresight, personnel alignment, and a unified approach to implementing policies. His insights highlight the need for strong leadership and a cohesive administration to overcome bureaucratic resistance and achieve meaningful change.

5. Deep State and Administrative Complexities Harvey addressed the challenges posed by the Deep State and the complexities of the U.S. government bureaucracy, emphasizing the need for strong leadership and clear strategies. “Navigating the administrative state is no small task,” Harvey stated. “It requires leadership that is not only decisive but also understands the intricacies of governance.”

He highlighted the importance of having a committed team that aligns with the administration’s goals, particularly in dealing with bureaucratic resistance. “The Deep State is a reality,” Harvey asserted. “It’s a powerful force that can stymie even the most well-intentioned reforms.”

Harvey pointed out the necessity for a close-knit group of advisors who understand the political landscape and are committed to executing the administration’s vision. “Loyalty and alignment are crucial,” he emphasized. “Without them, the best-laid plans can be derailed by entrenched interests within the bureaucracy.”

He also discussed the challenges of implementing policies in the face of institutional inertia, highlighting the need for strategic foresight and a clear understanding of the bureaucratic landscape. “The complexities of government require a nuanced approach,” Harvey explained. “It’s about more than just policy; it’s about execution and overcoming resistance.”

In his view, overcoming these challenges requires a unified administration with strong leadership and a clear strategy. “The path to meaningful change is fraught with obstacles,” Harvey concluded. “But with the right team and a clear vision, it is possible to navigate the complexities of the administrative state and achieve significant progress.”

Harvey’s insights into the Deep State and administrative complexities really show the importance of strategic leadership and personnel alignment. His analysis highlights the need for a cohesive approach to governance, recognizing the challenges posed by bureaucratic resistance and the necessity of a committed team to implement meaningful reforms.

6. Need for Strategic Foresight Harvey emphasized the importance of strategic foresight in preparing for future administrations, warning that without it, future leaders might face the same obstacles that plagued previous ones. “Strategic foresight is not a luxury; it’s a necessity,” Harvey stated. “Without it, administrations are doomed to repeat the mistakes of the past.”

He highlighted the importance of a close-knit group of advisors who understand the political landscape and are committed to the administration’s goals. “The right team is essential,” Harvey explained. “They need to be aligned with the president’s vision and capable of executing it effectively.”

Harvey discussed the challenges of navigating the complexities of governance, emphasizing the need for strategic planning and personnel loyalty. “The political landscape is complex and ever-changing,” he remarked. “Having a strategic plan and a committed team is crucial to navigating these challenges.”

He also warned of the dangers of failing to address bureaucratic resistance and institutional inertia, highlighting the necessity of strong leadership and a clear strategy. “Bureaucratic resistance is a reality that must be overcome,” Harvey asserted. “It’s about more than just policy; it’s about execution and overcoming entrenched interests.”

title: VOTING MATTERS: America’s Unique Individual Rights vs. The Left’s Groupthink
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: On Saturday's WarRoom, William Federer’s discussion with Dave Brat exposed the unique American conception of individual rights and contrasted it...
content:
On Saturday’s WarRoom, William Federer’s discussion with Dave Brat exposed the unique American conception of individual rights and contrasted it sharply with contemporary leftist views centered on group identity and the points they made are crucial for an educated society to have when considering who they should vote for in the next election.

“The founders of America looked to the pre-King Saul part of the Bible, where people were directly accountable to God, not to an earthly ruler. When we understand that our rights come from a Creator, not the state, we recognize that our leadership and voting decisions should uphold the principle of individual rights over groupthink,” Federer told Brat. 

Federer asserts that America’s foundational principle of individual rights is rooted in a belief in a Creator, which contrasts with the modern left’s focus on group identity and intersectionality.

On the program, Federer highlights that the American notion of individual rights derives from the Judeo-Christian understanding that each person is made in the image of God. He explains, “Judeo-Christian faith gave birth to the concept of the individual… your worth is not dependent on the group, but because you’re made in the image of the Creator.” This belief posits that every person holds intrinsic value, regardless of their social or political status. Federer contrasts this with historical and contemporary systems where worth is often linked to one’s position within a group or allegiance to a ruler.

Federer points out that personal value was tied to one’s relationship with the ruling authority in traditional honor-shame cultures and monarchies. “If you’re worth something to the government or the king, your worth goes up. If you’re not supporting them, your worth goes down. And if you’re their enemy, you’re dead.” This system emphasizes a top-down approach where individual value is contingent on group dynamics and political loyalty.

In contrast, Federer underscores that America’s founders drew on the pre-King Saul period of the Bible, which emphasized individual accountability to God rather than subservience to a monarch. “The founders of America looked to the pre-King Saul part of the Bible,” he explains. This aspect of biblical history highlights a model where individuals are valued and held accountable directly by God, not by earthly rulers.

Federer criticizes modern liberalism for abandoning these principles, arguing that contemporary leftist ideologies prioritize group identity over individual worth. He asserts, “Liberals really don’t believe in equality. They believe in intersectionality—that your worth is dependent on what group you belong to and the more minority groups you belong to, your worth goes up.” This approach, Federer argues, undermines the foundational American belief in inherent individual rights, which are seen as granted by a Creator rather than by the state.

The discussion reveals Federer’s view that without believing in a Creator, individual rights become precarious. He states, “If there is no Creator, then the rights come from the government… if the state gives rights, it can and inevitably will take them away.” This perspective underscores his concern that the erosion of the Creator-based understanding of rights could lead to a system where the state grants and revokes rights.

Federer’s dialogue with Brat emphasizes a stark contrast between America’s foundational principles of individual rights, derived from a belief in a Creator, and the modern left’s focus on group identity and state-granted rights. He contends that the essence of American liberty and individual value is inseparable from its Judeo-Christian origins, and that abandoning these roots risks undermining the concept of individual rights.

Federer finished by laying out a call to action for Christians to understand the importance of voting and defending these important foundational issues in the United States.

For more context, watch the full segment featuring Will Federer:

William J. Federer Walks Through How The God Gives You Value, Not Your Intersectionality Group

SOME THINGS TO THINK ABOUT FROM THE WAR ROOM DISCUSSION:

In recent years, there has been a significant shift in the political landscape toward expanding government influence in various sectors, often described as the rise of “the Administrative State.”

This movement, characterized by increased regulation, oversight, and intervention, has profound implications for everyday citizens, affecting everything from healthcare and education to personal freedoms and economic opportunities.

These are points people should consider when choosing who they will vote for.

Regulatory Expansion:

The US Government at various levels have increasingly implemented regulations across numerous industries, impacting how businesses operate and how individuals engage with essential services. The intention is often to ensure safety, protect the environment, and promote fair practices, but the outcome can be burdensome compliance costs for businesses and limited choices for consumers.

Healthcare:

The expansion of government in healthcare aims to increase access to medical services, but it often leads to debates over the efficiency and quality of care. Policies like universal healthcare or government-managed systems raise questions about the balance between accessibility and innovation.

Education:

Government intervention in education through standardized testing and curriculum guidelines is intended to raise educational standards. However, it can also lead to a one-size-fits-all approach that stifles creativity and fails to address local community needs.

Economic Impact:

Large government programs and initiatives often require significant public funding, impacting taxation and public debt. While these programs can stimulate growth and support vulnerable populations, they can also strain the economy if not managed effectively.

Personal Freedoms:

The growth of government power often raises concerns about individual liberties, privacy, and autonomy. Surveillance, data collection, and restrictions on free speech are contentious issues that challenge the balance between security and freedom.

Political and Social Polarization:

The rise of Big Government can exacerbate political divides, with debates over the appropriate role of government in society. Different ideological perspectives on government intervention lead to polarization, impacting social cohesion and public discourse.

The rise of Big Government, also called the Administrative state, presents a complex array of challenges and opportunities.

While the goal is often to protect and support citizens, expanding government influence requires careful consideration to avoid unintended consequences that may limit individual freedoms and economic vitality.

Engaging in informed dialogue and analysis is crucial for navigating this evolving landscape and ensuring that government actions align with society’s diverse needs and values.

title: Unmasking the Secret Hand in the Shadow World Government: The Unseen Web of Power and Influence with Lara Logan
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: In today's increasingly interconnected world, Investigative journalist Lara Logan has exposed a shadowy network of radical organizations and groups that...
content:
In today’s increasingly interconnected world, Investigative journalist Lara Logan has exposed a shadowy network of radical organizations and groups that has emerged, wielding immense power and influence without the accountability expected in democratic societies.

Logan reported on Thursday’s WarRoom that these entities operate under the guise of progressive political ideals and charitable missions but harbor a sinister agenda to dominate humanity.

As journalist Logan pointed out to WarRoom host Dave Brat, these groups form “a global cult” that manipulates political and social dynamics to further their interests.

Logan described for Brat that the backbone of this shadow government is a network of Affinity groups, loosely connected organizations that share common ideologies and goals. She reported that these groups ranged from Marxist collectives to environmental and animal rights organizations. They function like a spider’s web, extending their reach into various sectors of society, often under the protection of legal bodies like the National Lawyers Guild.

Logan noted, “Anytime you see this kind of language, you know, mutual aid is a Marxist dog whistle,” indicating how seemingly innocuous terms conceal deeper agendas.

These affinity groups are ideologically driven and financially and strategically supported by influential non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and foundations. Organizations like the Open Society Foundation, the Kellogg Foundation, the Ford Foundation, and the Tides Foundation are often the financial lifelines for these groups, enabling them to pursue their objectives without facing significant opposition or scrutiny.

Logan explained, “They’re financed by non-governmental organizations. This is how they set up a money laundering operation,” highlighting the opaque financial practices that allow these groups to thrive.

What makes this shadow government particularly alarming is its global reach. These organizations have offices and operations worldwide, creating a unified front that can influence international policy and societal norms. “These issues are now completely global,” Logan remarked, pointing to the seamless spread of ideologies across borders. Technology and social media play a crucial role in this expansion, allowing for the rapid dissemination of ideas and coordination of activities on a global scale.

Logan told Brat to imagine if historical figures like Hitler or Marx had access to today’s technology, which Logan ominously highlighted: “If they had had access to billions of people all over the planet for their message, that would have been absolutely devastating.”

The reality of such technological power is no longer hypothetical; it’s being wielded by these modern-day organizations, shaping narratives and public opinion worldwide.

title: Trump’s Resilient Lead and Kamala Harris’ Struggle Exposed by Rasmussen Polling in the WarRoom
author: KARI DONOVAN
excerpt: On Thursday's War Room, Mark Mitchell of Rasmussen Polling unveiled a detailed analysis of the current polling landscape, specifically focusing...
content:
On Thursday’s War Room, Mark Mitchell of Rasmussen Polling unveiled a detailed analysis of the current polling landscape, specifically focusing on a hypothetical presidential race between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.

The key takeaway from Mitchell’s presentation was that Trump is maintaining a steady lead over Harris despite a brief surge for the Vice President following Barack Obama’s recent endorsement.

Mitchell reported, “Donald Trump is still beating Kamala Harris by five points in a two-way matchup.”

He noted that this data is based on six polling days and reflects a broader trend rather than short-term fluctuations. Mitchell criticized early polls showing Harris with an advantage, suggesting they were skewed by media bias and incomplete data.

“A lot of people rush to put polls out… and I think there’s reasons that you could look at those polls internals and say, that’s really not what’s happening,” he argued.

The so-called “Obama bounce,” a spike in Harris’s popularity following the endorsement, has since dissipated. Mitchell highlighted this with the observation, “Trump has steadily clawed that lead back, and he’s up four points on the 30th, five points on the 31st.” Mitchell told host Dave Brat that this rebound illustrates Trump’s resilience amid a barrage of media scrutiny and attacks.

Mitchell critically analyzed the demographics, noting that while Trump is gaining among men and independents, his support among women and younger voters remains more volatile. “He’s losing a little more with 18 to 39-year-olds… but he was tied in the two-way matchup,” Mitchell explained.

This variability suggests that while Trump’s overall position is strong, certain voter groups may still be influenced by ongoing events and media narratives.

The pollster also discussed the broader electoral landscape, indicating that Trump’s lead is “comfortably outside the margin of error” and in line with other reputable polls. “The race is looking more like a two-way matchup,” Mitchell said, implying that despite some fluctuations, Trump’s overall advantage remains significant.

Mitchell’s data also underscored the limitations of multi-way matchups versus two-way races. He observed that in multi-way polls, Trump’s lead narrows to about 1.5 points, compared to a more consistent five-point lead in two-way scenarios. This discrepancy suggests that support for third-party candidates like Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is minimal, impacting the overall dynamics of the race.

Mitchell’s analysis paints a picture of a resilient Trump maintaining a solid lead over Harris despite the temporary boost from high-profile endorsements and media coverage.

The data he collected reflects a stable trend in favor of Trump, even as the race evolves with changing voter sentiments and external influences.

As Mitchell concluded, “Donald Trump is settling into a 49-50 point range,” indicating a strong and consistent lead in the face of ongoing challenges.
